pullrequest.title: Implemented AddLinkForce for ODE with integration tests

content.raw:
Some comments as an end user on the documentation related to this functions. 

I quote Wikipedia inline not because it is a reputable source, but because it is the standard place where 90 percent
of the users will check in case of doubt.  

 * `AddInertialForce` documentation refers to the "inertial frame", and I get from the context that is referring to the SDF inertial frame (because offset zero == COG ), but the traditional definition of the "inertial frame" is another [1] and it is in a sense more similar to the Gazebo "world frame". Perhaps an alternative name (but still possibly a lot confusing) can be "inertia frame", in the sense of the frame where the 3d inertia matrix is expressed? 

* The documentation repeatedly specify the input force vector is a "free vector", but the classical definition for "free vector" is a vector whose effect is independent from the point of application, such as a force couple. [2] In this case instead we are applying the specified vector to a point. 

[1] : http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Inertial_frame_of_reference

[2] : http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Couple_%28mechanics%29
